intro: Coussarea hoehnei, commonly known as the Hoehne's coussarea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and dense, evergreen foliage. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically displaying white or pale pink hues. Coussarea hoehnei is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and mountainous regions.
